Assessment.QuestionText: Which of these statements about displaying, printing, and buffering GDI+ objects are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: The <font face="courier new">DrawImage()</font> method of <font face="courier new">Graphics</font> class is used to draw the image into the buffer.
The <font face="courier new">Bitmap</font> class is inherited from the <font face="courier new">Image</font> class.
The <font face="courier new">PrintDocuments</font> class is used to print the GDI+ objects.
Double buffering is used to render the images faster on the screen.
The <font face="courier new">DoubleBuffer</font> property is used to enable double buffering.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)–(False), (B)–(True), (C)–(False), (D)–(True), and (E)-(False).
